Job Title: Staff Accountant

Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Staff Accountant to join our team. As a Staff Accountant, you will be responsible for maintaining accurate and up-to-date financial records, preparing financial statements, and providing support to our accounting and finance team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting, excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to work well under pressure.

Responsibilities:

* Prepare and maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records, including general ledger entries, journal entries, and account reconciliations
* Prepare financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements
* Conduct financial analysis and provide recommendations to management
* Assist with budgeting and forecasting processes
* Maintain and reconcile accounts payable, accounts receivable, and other financial accounts
* Prepare and submit reports to management and other stakeholders
* Provide support to the accounting and finance team, including training and mentoring junior staff
* Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive financial information with discretion

Requirements:

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field
* 5+ years of experience in accounting, preferably in a corporate setting
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel
* Experience with accounting software, such as SAP, Great Plains, or Oracle
* Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate records
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Preferred Qualifications:

* Certified Public Accountant (CPA) certification
* Master's degree in Accounting or related field
* Experience with budgeting and forecasting processes
* Knowledge of accounting principles and practices
* Experience with financial reporting and compliance

Work Environment:

* The Staff Accountant will work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, with frequent deadlines and changing priorities.
* The position requires strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently.
* The Staff Accountant will be required to communicate effectively with colleagues and management, and to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive financial information with discretion.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for professional growth and development. If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for accounting, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Note: This job description is a summary of the main responsibilities and requirements of the position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of every task or duty that may be required of the Staff Accountant.

**Job Title:** Detective - Health Care/Disability Fraud Investigator

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Detective to investigate and combat insurance fraud, with a focus on health care and disability fraud. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in law enforcement and insurance fraud investigation, with excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills. The successful candidate will be responsible for investigating complex cases, conducting interviews and interrogations, gathering and analyzing evidence, and testifying in court.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Investigate and prosecute cases of insurance fraud, including health care provider/billing fraud, disability fraud, workers' compensation fraud, premium fraud, property and casualty fraud, and staged automobile collisions.
* Conduct thorough and independent investigations, with minimal supervision, to identify and gather evidence of fraudulent activities.
* Generate FD-1s from consumer complaints and evaluate the evidentiary merit and strength of each referral.
* Identify "red flags" and create appropriate case investigative plans.
* Write, obtain judicial approval for, and execute search and arrest warrants as needed.
* Serve as both team leader and on-site supervisor when executing search and arrest warrants.
* Gather and analyze evidence, including billing and medical records, claims records, payroll and personnel records, insurance policies, police reports, and photographs.
* Conduct interviews, interrogations, and obtain confessions from suspects.
* Conduct skip tracing and locate witnesses using databases and field work.
* Maintain an excellent working relationship with the District Attorney's Office and other law enforcement agencies.
* Testify in court, including grand jury cases, and serve as an expert witness on premium fraud.
* Conduct surveillance, both stationary and mobile.
* Serve as a firearms instructor and field training officer to peers.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Criminal Justice or a related field.
* 24 years of experience in law enforcement, with a focus on insurance fraud investigation.
* Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and database searches/methodologies.
* Experience with surveillance, skip tracing, and witness locating.
* Ability to testify in court and serve as an expert witness.
* Valid California Peace Officer Standards and Training (P.O.S.T.) certification.
* Specialized training in health care fraud, staged auto collisions, workers' compensation fraud, identity theft, and other relevant areas.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience as a team leader or on-site supervisor.
* Experience with firearms and defensive tactics.
* Certification as a firearms instructor.
* Experience with emergency vehicle operations and first aid/CPR.
* Knowledge of California law and regulations related to insurance fraud and law enforcement.

**Work Environment:**

* The position will be based in a law enforcement agency in San Diego County, California.
* The agency is a dynamic and fast-paced environment with a focus on combating insurance fraud.
* The successful candidate will be expected to work independently and as part of a team to achieve results.

**Salary and Benefits:**

* The salary for this position will be competitive and based on experience.
* The agency offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as retirement and leave benefits.

* The individual will be expected to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.

**Job Title:** Senior Database Administrator

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking an experienced Senior Database Administrator to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the design, implementation, maintenance, and support of our database infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Oracle databases, SQL Server, and AWS infrastructure, with experience in database administration, performance tuning, and troubleshooting.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide technical leadership and expertise in the design, implementation, and maintenance of database infrastructure
* Plan, install, configure, and upgrade multiple Oracle databases (11.2.0.4 to 12.2.0) and SQL Server databases (2008, 2012)
* Migrate databases from on-premise to AWS using Database migration services
* Launch and maintain RDS and EC2 instances in AWS
* Create Snapshots, Elastic IPs, EBS Volumes, Security Groups per client request
* Plan and implement high availability solutions such as Real Application Cluster (RAC) in Oracle 11gR2 Grid and 10g on ASM and ACFS file systems
* Migrate multiple stand-alone databases to RAC databases using Rconfig, RMAN, and OEM
* Implement TDE, Data Redaction, and database Auditing to improve data integrity and security
* Apply PSU patches and upgrade multiple databases from 10g to 11g
* Replicate data in real-time using Oracle Golden Gate and Oracle Streams
* Troubleshoot Golden Gate-related issues
* Design and implement different backup strategies using RMAN and Datapump
* Schedule RMAN backups, purge jobs, and maintenance jobs using DBMS_JOBS, DBMS_SCHEDULER, and Crontab
* Implement and manage logical backup/recovery with Datapump and Export/Import utilities
* Clone databases using RMAN and manually using scripts
* Implement Point In Time Recovery on one or more tablespaces to recover lost data without downtime
* Install and configure SQL Server EE 2012 on Windows and create databases, triggers, tables, procedures, functions, and database diagrams
* Troubleshoot performance issues and maintain high availability and security of databases

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or related field
* 6+ years of experience in database administration, with a strong background in Oracle databases, SQL Server, and AWS infrastructure
* Hands-on experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager, Real Application Cluster, ASM, Transportable Tablespaces, SQL*Loader, RMAN, DataPump, Export, and Import
* Strong understanding of database design, performance tuning, and troubleshooting
* Experience with database migration services, AWS RDS and EC2, and VPC
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work efficiently in a 24/7 environment
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Proficient in SQL*PLUS, PL/SQL, UNIX Shell Scripting, Ksh, bash

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience with Toad, Putty, X-wing32, and WinSCP
* Knowledge of database security and auditing tools
* Familiarity with cloud-based database management systems

**Working Conditions:**

* The job requires working in a fast-paced environment, with frequent deadlines and changing priorities
* The job requires working 24/7, including weekends and holidays
* The job requires frequent travel to clients' sites or working remotely

**How to Apply:**

Please submit your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!
